title: Andrea Mazzantini
text:
Andrea Mazzantini (born 11 July 1968) is an Italian former professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Association%20footballer">player</a> who played as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Career.
Mazzantini started his career with amateur club Canaletto under Adriano Buffon, the father of Italian goalkeeper <a href="Gianluigi%20Buffon">Gianluigi Buffon</a>.
After playing six seasons between <a href="Serie%20C2">Serie C2</a> and <a href="Lega%20Pro%20Prima%20Divisione">Serie C1</a>, Mazzantini was appointed as a first choice goalkeeper by <a href="Venezia%20F.C.">Venezia</a> chairman, <a href="Maurizio%20Zamparini">Maurizio Zamparini</a>. 
After three seasons spent in <a href="Serie%20B">Serie B</a>, Mazzantini moved to <a href="Inter%20Milan">Inter Milan</a> where he used to be the backup choice of Italy international <a href="Gianluca%20Pagliuca">Gianluca Pagliuca</a>. 
He played his first <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> game in <a href="1996%E2%80%9397%20Serie%20A">1996-97</a>, when replaced Pagliuca against <a href="A.C.%20Reggiana%201919">Reggiana</a> in the second half. Likewise, he played his second and last game with Inter in the final match of season <a href="1997%E2%80%9398%20Serie%20A">1997-98</a> against <a href="Empoli%20F.C.">Empoli</a>.
In January 1999 he moved to Perugia where he played three seasons and half under <a href="Serse%20Cosmi">Serse Cosmi</a>, prior to move to <a href="A.C.N.%20Siena%201904">Siena</a> at the beginning of season <a href="2002%E2%80%9303%20Serie%20B">2002-2003</a>. However, he did not manage to make an appearance with them as he suffered a car accident and was forced to an early retirement. 
Honours.
Inter
